title: Will Russia launch a manned mission to the Moon before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the Russian Federation successfully launches and completes a manned mission to the Moon, where 'successful' is defined as a mission where astronauts land on the lunar surface and return safely to Earth. The mission must be officially recognized by Roscosmos or another authoritative space agency. In the event of a joint mission involving Russia and other countries, the mission will still resolve as Yes if Russian astronauts are part of the crew that lands on the Moon. If no such mission is launched, or if a mission is launched but does not meet the above criteria, the question will resolve as No. In the case of ambiguity or lack of clear public information by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No unless official statements or evidence are provided by Roscosmos or an equivalent authoritative body that confirm the mission's success as per the defined criteria.

title: Will Iran successfully place a satellite in orbit using its own launch vehicle before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the Islamic Republic of Iran successfully places a satellite into Earth's orbit using a launch vehicle that is designed, manufactured, and launched by Iran without significant foreign assistance. The satellite must complete at least one full orbit around Earth to be considered successful. The resolution will be based on official statements from the Iranian Space Agency or a recognized international space authority such as the United Nations Office for Outer Space Affairs (UNOOSA) or the North American Aerospace Defense Command (NORAD). In the event of conflicting reports, the majority consensus among these authoritative sources will be used to determine the outcome. If no satellite launch attempt is publicly acknowledged by the aforementioned authorities by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In the case of ambiguity or lack of clear public records, the question will remain unresolved until sufficient evidence is provided.

title: Will an infectious disease outbreak occur on the International Space Station before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, there is a confirmed case of an infectious disease outbreak on the International Space Station (ISS) as reported by either the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA), the Russian Federal Space Agency (Roscosmos), the European Space Agency (ESA), or any other participating space agency of the ISS program. An 'outbreak' is defined as an occurrence of a disease greater in number than expected in a defined area among a specific group of people over a particular period of time. For the purposes of this question, an outbreak must involve at least three members of the ISS crew. Confirmation must come from official press releases, reports, or direct statements from the agencies mentioned above. In the event that the ISS is decommissioned or no longer in use before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If there is no official report or statement from the aforementioned agencies by the resolution date, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will the Food and Drug Administration approve a new class of weight-loss drugs by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has granted approval to at least one new pharmacological drug that is classified as a distinct and novel class for the purpose of weight loss. The drug must be intended for long-term use in the management of obesity and must not be a combination of previously approved drugs, a reformulation of a single existing drug, or a repurposing of a drug approved for a different indication.

The approval must be a full approval for general use, not limited to emergency use authorization, compassionate use, or similar limited or temporary approvals. The resolution will be based on official FDA announcements or press releases. In the event that the FDA is dissolved or its responsibilities significantly altered, the resolution will default to the successor organization or regulatory body with equivalent authority over drug approvals in the United States.

If no such approval is granted by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will North Korea engage in a significant trade deal with a G7 country by 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2024, the government of North Korea and the government of any G7 country (Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom, or the United States) enter into a trade agreement that meets the following conditions:

- The trade deal must be officially announced by both participating countries through a government press release or an official statement by a government representative.

- The trade deal must involve the exchange of goods or services with a total value of at least $100 million USD, as reported by an authoritative source such as the International Trade Centre or the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development.

- The trade deal must be new, meaning it cannot be an extension, renewal, or modification of an existing agreement.

- In the event that the trade deal is not publicly disclosed, a statement from an authoritative third-party international body, such as the World Trade Organization, confirming the existence and details of the deal will be considered sufficient for resolution.

- If a trade deal is announced but not implemented due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., political changes, sanctions), the question will resolve as No unless the deal is ratified and comes into effect before the resolution date.

title: Will Virginia's GDP rank within the top 10 states in the USA by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, according to the data published by the Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) of the United States Department of Commerce, the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of the Commonwealth of Virginia ranks within the top 10 states of the USA at any point in time before December 31, 2025. The ranking will be determined based on the nominal GDP figures without adjusting for inflation or purchasing power parity. In the event that the BEA discontinues its publication or changes its methodology in a way that prevents direct comparison with previous data, the question will resolve using the most comparable official data source available at the time of resolution. If no such data is available, a panel of five economic experts with recognized expertise in state-level economic analysis will be convened to determine Virginia's GDP ranking based on the best available data and methodologies. The decision of this panel will be considered final for the purpose of resolving this question.

title: Will Donald Trump announce the creation of a new technology company before the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump, or a spokesperson or entity directly associated with him, publicly announces the creation of a new technology company before December 31, 2024. The announcement must be verifiable through credible media outlets, official press releases, or direct public statements from Donald Trump or his representatives. The company must be focused on developing or providing technological products, services, or platforms, and the announcement should include the company's name, its technological focus, and a brief description of its intended products or services. If Donald Trump passes away before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No, unless the announcement has already been made. If there is ambiguity regarding the company's focus on technology, the resolution will be based on the predominant interpretation by major technology news outlets. In the event of a dispute, a panel of three technology industry experts will be convened to determine the resolution.

title: Will Japan launch a mission to mine resources from an asteroid by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the government of Japan or any Japan-based private entity has successfully launched a space mission with the primary objective of extracting resources from an asteroid. The mission must be verifiable through official announcements or credible media reports. The criteria for a successful launch include:

- The spacecraft must be on a trajectory that will intersect with the intended asteroid's orbit.
- The mission must include equipment specifically designed for the extraction and processing of asteroid materials.
- The mission's primary goal must be the extraction of resources, rather than scientific exploration or technology demonstration.

In the event that a mission is launched but does not meet all the specified criteria, the question will resolve as No. If no mission is launched by the specified date, the question will also resolve as No.

If multiple missions are launched, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one mission meets all the criteria. If the mission is launched but the outcome is not publicly disclosed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as ambiguous and all bets will be refunded.

title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) implement a nationwide health monitoring system using wearable technology by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has officially announced and implemented a nationwide health monitoring system in the United States that utilizes wearable technology to track health metrics. The system must be actively used by at least 1% of the U.S. population, with data being collected and analyzed for public health research or monitoring purposes. The wearable technology should be capable of measuring at least three vital health metrics such as heart rate, body temperature, and physical activity levels. The resolution will rely on official statements from the CDC, coverage by at least three major news outlets, or a peer-reviewed publication confirming the system's implementation and usage statistics. In the event of partial implementation or pilot programs not meeting the full criteria, the question will resolve as No.

metadata.tags: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

title: Will the value of the US dollar be directly affected by a nuclear incident before 2030?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, there is a nuclear incident that directly affects the value of the US dollar. A 'nuclear incident' is defined as an unplanned event or series of events that have caused or could cause significant harm to people, the environment, or property, including but not limited to nuclear accidents, detonation of a nuclear weapon, or significant radioactive contamination. The 'value of the US dollar' will be considered directly affected if there is a change of more than 5% in the USD index (DXY) within a 30-day period that can be directly attributed to the nuclear incident by reports from at least three major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal). In the absence of such an incident, the question will resolve as No. If the nuclear incident occurs but the direct effect on the US dollar's value cannot be established, the question will also resolve as No. In the event of conflicting reports or ambiguity in attribution, the question will be resolved by a panel of three economic experts, whose decision will be final.

title: Will Joe Biden initiate a significant policy change regarding nuclear arms control during his presidency?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, during Joe Biden's term as President of the United States, a new treaty or executive agreement is signed, ratified, or enacted that represents a significant change in nuclear arms control policy. Significant change is defined as any of the following:

- A reduction of at least 10% in the active nuclear arsenal of the United States as publicly reported by the U.S. Department of Defense or a comparable authoritative source.

- The establishment of a new arms control treaty with at least one other nuclear-armed state that includes verifiable measures and has been ratified by the U.S. Senate.

- A unilateral action by the U.S. that is recognized by at least two recognized experts in the field of nuclear arms control as a significant policy change, with such recognition reported in at least two reputable media outlets.

In the event that Joe Biden is not President for the full term, the question will resolve as No unless a significant policy change as defined above has already occurred during his time in office. If Joe Biden's presidency ends prematurely due to resignation, impeachment, or incapacity, and a significant policy change occurs within 90 days of the end of his term, the question will still resolve as Yes, provided the policy change can be directly attributed to initiatives started during his presidency.

title: Will the Bureau of Labor Statistics report a significant change in employment within the nuclear sector by 2025?
body:
The question will resolve as Yes if the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reports a change in employment within the nuclear sector that meets the following criteria by December 31, 2025:

- A significant increase is defined as a rise of at least 10% in the total number of employed nuclear engineers, nuclear technicians, or other nuclear-related occupations as reported in the BLS Occupational Employment and Wage Statistics (OEWS) compared to the figures reported for the year 2020.

- A significant decrease is defined as a reduction of at least 10% in the total number of employed nuclear engineers, nuclear technicians, or other nuclear-related occupations as reported in the BLS OEWS compared to the figures reported for the year 2020.

- In the event that the BLS changes its reporting methodology or the OEWS is discontinued, a comparable official report or dataset from the BLS will be used to determine the change in employment.

- If no official report or dataset is available by the resolution date, expert analysis from three recognized economists in the field of labor statistics will be used to determine if a significant change has occurred, based on available data and industry trends.

- If the nuclear sector is redefined or split into new categories by the BLS, the combined figures of the new categories that most closely align with the original nuclear sector definition will be used for comparison.

title: Will a significant political event involving biotechnology policy occur in any major country before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, any of the following events occur in at least one of the G7 countries (Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom, or the United States):

1. The enactment of a new federal law or significant amendment to an existing law that substantially changes the regulation of biotechnological research, development, or commercialization.

2. A landmark court decision at the federal level that sets a precedent affecting the biotechnology sector, such as intellectual property rights, ethical considerations, or market access.

3. An executive order or similar high-level governmental directive that alters the strategic direction or funding priorities for biotechnology.

4. The establishment of a major international treaty or agreement between G7 countries specifically focused on biotechnology governance.

In the event that multiple qualifying events occur, the earliest event will be considered for resolution. The resolution will be based on official government publications, reputable media reports, or statements from the involved entities. If no such event occurs, or if the events are not publicly disclosed or verifiable, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Russia experience a change in presidential leadership before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, any individual other than Vladimir Putin is officially recognized as the President of Russia by the Russian government or if Vladimir Putin is no longer in office due to resignation, impeachment, incapacity, or death. The resolution will be based on official statements from the Russian government, reports from at least three internationally recognized news organizations, or a public inauguration of a new president. In the event of disputed claims to the presidency, the question will resolve as Yes only if the new claimant is recognized by the United Nations as the legitimate president of Russia. If Vladimir Putin's term is extended beyond 2030 through constitutional amendments or other legal means without a change in individual holding the office, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Democratic Party (US) hold a majority in both the House of Representatives and the Senate simultaneously at any point before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, at any point before January 1, 2030, the Democratic Party holds more than 50% of the seats in both the House of Representatives and the Senate of the United States simultaneously. The count of seats must be based on the official results of elections, special elections, or appointments that are recognized by the relevant legal and governmental authorities. In the event of a tie in the Senate, the Vice President's party affiliation will determine the majority. If the Democratic Party holds exactly 50% of the seats in the Senate and the Vice President is a Democrat, this will be considered a majority. The resolution will not be affected by temporary absences or vacancies unless they last for more than 6 months without a resolution, such as a special election or appointment. In such a case, the majority status will be based on the number of active, filled seats. If there is a dispute over the legitimacy of any members or the results of an election, the resolution will defer to the final decision of the highest relevant legal authority.

title: Will Russia create a state-backed cryptocurrency by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Russian government or any entity acting on its behalf has officially created and released a state-backed cryptocurrency. The cryptocurrency must be recognized by the Central Bank of Russia or another relevant regulatory authority and be available for use by the public or specific sectors. The resolution will be based on official statements, press releases, or government documents confirming the creation and release of the cryptocurrency. In the event of ambiguity or lack of clear official communication, credible reports from major financial news outlets will be considered sufficient to resolve the question. If multiple cryptocurrencies are released, only the first one that meets these criteria will be considered for resolution. If a cryptocurrency is announced but not released to the public by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a cryptocurrency be primarily used for robotics transactions by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a cryptocurrency is used for more than 50% of all recorded transactions for the purchase of robots, robotic components, or robotic services globally. The cryptocurrency must be recognized by the International Standards Organization (ISO) and have a dedicated ISO 4217 code. Transactions must be verifiable through blockchain records or equivalent transparent ledger technology. Transactions exclusively between entities under common ownership or control will not be counted. In the event of a dispute or ambiguity regarding the primary use, the resolution will be based on the consensus of at least three reports from credible financial analysis firms or international economic organizations.

title: Will a cryptocurrency dedicated to healthcare transactions enter the top 10 by market capitalization before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a cryptocurrency primarily dedicated to healthcare transactions is listed among the top 10 cryptocurrencies by market capitalization according to CoinMarketCap or an equivalent authoritative source. The cryptocurrency must be specifically designed for healthcare-related transactions, such as payments for medical services, health insurance, pharmaceutical purchases, or health data management. The market capitalization will be determined by the daily historical snapshot on CoinMarketCap (or equivalent source) on December 31, 2029. If CoinMarketCap is no longer operational or considered authoritative, the next most recognized data source by the crypto community will be used. In the event of a fork in the cryptocurrency, the version with the highest market capitalization will be considered. If no cryptocurrency meets these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an AI system designed for aerospace engineering applications achieve a significant breakthrough in autonomous flight control before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, an AI system specifically designed for aerospace engineering applications is credited with a significant breakthrough in autonomous flight control. A 'significant breakthrough' is defined as a development that allows for a new level of autonomy in flight control systems, such as fully autonomous navigation and decision-making in complex, dynamic environments without human intervention. The breakthrough must be documented in at least two reputable aerospace industry publications or recognized by a major aerospace authority such as NASA, the FAA, or EASA. The AI system must be the primary contributor to the breakthrough, and the achievement must be a first-of-its-kind in the field of aerospace engineering. Developments that are mere incremental improvements over existing technologies will not qualify. In the event of ambiguity or lack of clear public information, the resolution will be based on the consensus of a panel of three aerospace engineering experts.

title: Will the Republican Party (US) utilize an AI system for strategizing in national elections before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, there is verifiable evidence that the Republican Party (US) has employed an artificial intelligence (AI) system for strategic decision-making in national elections. The AI system must be involved in tasks such as voter targeting, campaign messaging, resource allocation, or other strategic operations. Confirmation can come from credible media reports, official party statements, or public records indicating the use of AI for these purposes. The AI system must be more advanced than simple data analytics tools and should involve elements of machine learning, natural language processing, or other advanced AI capabilities. In the absence of direct evidence, credible expert testimony or insider confirmation may be considered sufficient. If no such evidence or confirmation is available by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will OpenAI release a model that surpasses GPT-4 in both scale and performance before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, OpenAI releases a new generative pre-trained transformer model that is both larger in scale and demonstrates superior performance compared to GPT-4. Scale is defined by the number of parameters, and performance is measured by benchmarks on a set of tasks including but not limited to natural language understanding, translation, question-answering, and summarization. The model must outperform GPT-4 on at least 75% of these tasks, with the results verified by an independent review or a peer-reviewed publication. The announcement must be made through official OpenAI channels or recognized media outlets. In the event that OpenAI is dissolved or rebranded, the question will resolve based on the actions of its successor entity. If no such model is released, or if the model released does not meet the criteria above, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a significant political event directly related to engineering, such as a major infrastructure bill or a national engineering project, be announced in the United States before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a significant political event directly related to engineering is announced in the United States. A 'significant political event' is defined as either the passing of a major infrastructure bill by both houses of Congress and signed into law by the President, or the official announcement of a national engineering project by the federal government. The infrastructure bill must allocate at least $100 billion to engineering projects, and the national engineering project must be a new initiative with a budget of at least $50 billion. The announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources, such as The New York Times or The Washington Post. In the event of ambiguity, the resolution will be based on the consensus of at least three recognized experts in political science or civil engineering.

title: Will a COVID-19 vaccine with an efficacy rate higher than 90% against all known variants be approved by the FDA before 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2024, a COVID-19 vaccine is approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) with a demonstrated efficacy rate higher than 90% against all known variants of the SARS-CoV-2 virus at the time of approval. The efficacy rate must be confirmed through Phase 3 clinical trial results published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or an official FDA statement. The vaccine must be designed for human use and receive Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) or full approval for public distribution. In the event that the FDA is dissolved or its functions are transferred to another entity, the approval must come from the successor organization responsible for vaccine evaluation and approval. If no vaccine meets these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new virology-related international treaty or agreement be established to prevent global pandemics before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a new international treaty or formal agreement focused on virology and the prevention of global pandemics is established and comes into effect. The treaty or agreement must be ratified or officially agreed upon by at least 50% of the member states of the World Health Organization (WHO). The treaty should aim to improve global coordination and response to potential pandemic threats, including but not limited to surveillance, data sharing, research collaboration, and resource mobilization. The establishment of the treaty or agreement must be confirmed by an official announcement from the WHO or through a United Nations resolution. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reporting from at least three major international news organizations will be considered sufficient for resolution. If multiple treaties or agreements are established, the one with the broadest scope and participation will be considered for resolution. In the event that the WHO is dissolved or replaced by another entity, the new entity's actions will be considered for resolution. If no such treaty or agreement is established by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Italy implement a regulatory framework for cryptocurrencies that includes licensing requirements for exchanges and wallet providers by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Italian government has enacted legislation or regulations that establish a licensing system for cryptocurrency exchanges and wallet service providers operating within Italy. The regulatory framework must include specific criteria and requirements for obtaining a license, as well as enforcement mechanisms for non-compliance. The resolution will be based on official publications or announcements from the Italian Ministry of Economy and Finance or other relevant regulatory authorities. In the event of ambiguity or partial implementation, the question will resolve as Yes only if the core licensing requirements are in place and operational. If no such framework is publicly announced or if the legislation is passed but not yet in effect by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will India officially recognize any cryptocurrency as legal tender by the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by 23:59:59 UTC on December 31, 2024, the Government of India, through its legislative or executive branches, officially recognizes any cryptocurrency as legal tender within its jurisdiction. Recognition as legal tender must be confirmed by an official government publication, such as a bill passed by the Indian Parliament, an ordinance, or an official gazette notification. The cryptocurrency must be usable for all debts, public charges, taxes, and dues within India. Private digital tokens, digital assets, or virtual currencies that are not recognized as legal tender will not satisfy this question's resolution criteria. In the event of ambiguity or partial recognition, the question will resolve as No unless a clear and official statement or legislation specifies otherwise. If no official recognition is granted by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major cryptocurrency implement quantum-resistant encryption algorithms in its protocol by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a cryptocurrency is widely recognized as 'major' by market capitalization (top 10 by market cap as listed on a reputable financial tracking service such as CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko) and has successfully integrated quantum-resistant encryption algorithms into its protocol. The integration must be active and in use within the main network (mainnet) of the cryptocurrency, not just proposed or in test environments. The quantum-resistant encryption must be acknowledged by a reputable cybersecurity firm or a peer-reviewed publication in the field of cryptography. In the event of ambiguity regarding the 'major' status of a cryptocurrency or the effectiveness of the encryption, a panel of experts from three different recognized institutions in the field of cryptography will make the final determination. If no cryptocurrency meets these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the United Kingdom hold a second referendum on Scottish independence by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by 31 December 2025, the United Kingdom government has officially sanctioned and set a date for a second referendum on Scottish independence, or if such a referendum has already taken place. The referendum must be legally recognized by the UK government and must be intended to decide whether Scotland should become an independent country separate from the United Kingdom. The resolution will rely on official announcements from the UK government or the Scottish government, as well as reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters). In the event of ambiguity regarding the legitimacy or recognition of the referendum, the question will resolve based on the majority recognition by the United Nations member states. If no referendum is announced or held by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a formal ceasefire agreement signed between Russia and Ukraine before 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2024, a formal ceasefire agreement is signed between the official government representatives of Russia and Ukraine. The agreement must be publicly acknowledged by both parties and must include a cessation of all military hostilities in the conflict zones recognized by the United Nations. The resolution will be based on reports from at least three independent and reputable international news organizations (e.g., BBC, Reuters, Al Jazeera) or official statements from the United Nations or the governments of Russia and Ukraine. In the event of a dispute over the terms or the implementation of the ceasefire, the question will resolve as No unless a subsequent agreement or clarification is issued that resolves the dispute to the satisfaction of both parties. If no formal agreement is signed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Taiwan declare formal independence from China before 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the government of Taiwan (officially known as the Republic of China) formally declares independence from the People's Republic of China through any of the following actions:

- An official proclamation by the President of Taiwan.
- A legislative act passed by the Legislative Yuan of Taiwan that explicitly states the intention to establish Taiwan as a sovereign state separate from the People's Republic of China.
- An amendment to the Constitution of the Republic of China that redefines the territorial scope and sovereignty of the state to exclude the People's Republic of China.

The declaration must be public and unambiguous, and it must be reported by at least three major international news agencies (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC).

In the event of ambiguity or multiple interpretations of actions taken by Taiwan's government, the resolution will be based on the majority international diplomatic recognition of Taiwan as an independent state by United Nations member states.

If Taiwan is formally recognized as an independent state by the United Nations before the resolution date, this will also result in a Yes resolution.

In the case of military conflict or other extraordinary circumstances that prevent a clear resolution, the question will be put on hold until a definitive outcome can be determined.

title: Will the global energy sector's contribution to GDP surpass 10% by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, according to the World Bank or another comparable international economic authority, the global energy sector's contribution to Gross Domestic Product (GDP) is reported to be equal to or greater than 10% at any point in the year 2030. The energy sector is defined as the sum of all industries and activities involved in the production and sale of energy, including fuel extraction, manufacturing, refining, and distribution. The contribution to GDP must be calculated using a consistent methodology as applied in previous years by the reporting authority. In the event that the World Bank or the chosen authority does not report this statistic by the resolution date, the question will resolve using the most recent and reliable data available from any of the following: International Energy Agency (IEA), U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA), or the Statistical Review of World Energy by BP. If none of these sources provide a clear answer, the question will resolve as N/A (not applicable).

title: Will Brazil enter the top 5 global economies by GDP at any point before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, at any point before December 31, 2030, Brazil's nominal Gross Domestic Product (GDP) ranks within the top 5 largest economies in the world, according to the International Monetary Fund's (IMF) World Economic Outlook database. The GDP figures should be based on current prices and market exchange rates, not adjusted for purchasing power parity (PPP). The resolution will be based on the official IMF reports, and any updates or revisions published by the IMF will be considered authoritative. In the event that the IMF ceases to exist, is unable to provide the necessary data, or if there is a significant delay in the publication of the relevant report, the resolution will rely on the next most authoritative source available, such as the World Bank or the United Nations. If none of these sources are available, a panel of at least three recognized economic experts will be convened to determine Brazil's ranking based on the best available data. This panel's decision will be final. If Brazil's economy enters the top 5 after the specified date due to data revisions for the period before December 31, 2030, the question will still resolve as Yes.

title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) allocate more than 20% of its annual budget to addressing economic impacts of health emergencies by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has officially allocated more than 20% of its annual budget for that fiscal year to initiatives specifically aimed at addressing the economic impacts of health emergencies. The allocation must be confirmed by official CDC budget documents or statements from authorized CDC representatives. The budget allocation can be for a single health emergency or multiple health emergencies, but must be explicitly earmarked for economic impact mitigation. If the CDC does not release its budget allocation by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If the CDC is dissolved or its budgetary responsibilities are significantly altered before the resolution date, an alternative authoritative source, such as the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services or its successor, will be used to determine the resolution.

metadata.tags: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

title: Will the total revenue of Major League Baseball exceed $15 billion by the year 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the total revenue of Major League Baseball (MLB) for any fiscal year before December 31, 2025, as reported by the MLB or a recognized financial authority, exceeds $15 billion USD. Total revenue includes all income streams such as ticket sales, broadcasting rights, merchandise, sponsorships, and digital media revenue. The revenue should be adjusted for inflation to 2021 dollars using the Consumer Price Index (CPI) provided by the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics or a similar authoritative source. In the event that the MLB ceases to exist, merges with another league, or undergoes a significant restructuring that makes direct comparison impossible, the question will resolve as No. If the MLB or a recognized financial authority fails to report the revenue by the resolution date, the question will resolve as Ambiguous.

title: Will a new blockbuster medication with sales surpassing $10 billion be released by a pharmaceutical company by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a pharmaceutical company releases a medication that achieves the following:

- The medication must be approved by either the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA), the European Medicines Agency (EMA), or an equivalent national regulatory authority in countries with a GDP ranking in the top 10 globally.

- The medication must generate sales exceeding $10 billion USD within any consecutive 12-month period before the resolution date, as reported by the company's official financial statements or verified by a reputable financial news source.

- The medication must be a new chemical entity (NCE) or a biologic that has not been previously marketed for any indication.

- Sales must be derived from the medication itself, not from associated combination therapies or diagnostic tools.

In the event that financial data is not publicly available or there is ambiguity regarding the sales figures, the resolution will be based on the consensus of at least three independent and reputable financial analysis firms.

If no medication meets these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the global space economy surpass $1 trillion in annual revenue by 2030?
body: The global space economy is defined as the total annual revenue generated from all space-related activities, including but not limited to satellite services, space exploration missions, space tourism, and the manufacturing of space-related technology and infrastructure. This question will resolve as Yes if credible financial reports or analyses from at least three recognized authorities in the field, such as the Space Foundation, Euroconsult, or the OECD, confirm that the total annual revenue of the global space economy has reached or exceeded $1 trillion USD at any point before December 31, 2030. The valuation should be adjusted for inflation to 2020 dollars to ensure comparability. In the event of conflicting reports, the average of the three most reputable sources will be used to determine the outcome. If no such reports are available by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a peer-reviewed scientific study demonstrating a practical application of string theory be published before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a peer-reviewed scientific study is published that demonstrates a practical application of string theory. The study must meet the following criteria:

- The study is published in a reputable scientific journal that is indexed by major scientific databases such as Web of Science or Scopus.

- The study's findings are based on empirical evidence that is reproducible and verifiable.

- The practical application must be clearly derived from the principles of string theory and must show a direct and unambiguous benefit or advancement in a field such as physics, engineering, or technology.

- The study must be cited by at least two independent peer-reviewed articles that confirm the practical application's validity and relevance.

- In the event that the study's findings are disputed or retracted before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

- If no such study is published by the resolution date, or if the study does not meet the above criteria, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will a major scientific organization publicly denounce climate change denial as a threat to global progress before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a major scientific organization, defined as an international or national academy of sciences or a scientific society with a membership exceeding 10,000 professional scientists, issues a formal statement or press release explicitly denouncing climate change denial as a direct threat to global progress. The statement must be accessible on the organization's official website or through a reputable news outlet. In the event of ambiguity regarding the organization's stance, the resolution will be based on the most direct and clear interpretation of the statement by Metaculus Admins. If no such statement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new technological breakthrough in renewable energy storage be announced before 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a technological breakthrough in renewable energy storage is announced that meets the following conditions:

- The breakthrough must represent a minimum of 30% improvement in energy density or efficiency over the current leading technology as of 2023, according to the U.S. Department of Energy or an equivalent authoritative body.

- The technology must be demonstrated in a peer-reviewed scientific publication or an official press release from a recognized institution or company in the field of renewable energy.

- The announcement must include verifiable data that confirms the breakthrough's performance metrics.

- The technology should be scalable and show potential for commercialization within the next 10 years.

- In the event that multiple announcements are made, the earliest announcement that meets all criteria will be considered for resolution.

- If no such announcement is made, or if the announcements made do not meet the specified criteria, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the development of AI technologies play a significant role in the outcome of the Russo-Ukrainian War by 2025?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there is substantial evidence that AI technologies have had a decisive impact on the military or strategic outcomes of the Russo-Ukrainian War. This may include, but is not limited to, the use of AI for strategic decision-making, autonomous weapon systems, intelligence gathering, or cyber warfare that demonstrably alters the course of the conflict. The impact must be acknowledged by at least two of the following: a United Nations report, statements from the military leadership of either Russia or Ukraine, or coverage in at least three major international news outlets. The evidence must be clear and direct, not speculative or based on indirect effects. In the absence of such evidence, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a quantum computer be used to significantly accelerate an AI's learning process by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2030, a quantum computer is utilized to enhance the learning process of an artificial intelligence system, resulting in a measurable and significant acceleration compared to classical computing methods. The acceleration must be demonstrated through peer-reviewed scientific research or an official statement from a recognized authority in the field of quantum computing or artificial intelligence. The learning process refers to the AI's ability to acquire, process, and apply knowledge and skills. Significant acceleration is defined as at least a 50% reduction in the time required for the AI to reach a predefined learning milestone, compared to the time it would take using the best available classical computing methods at the time of the achievement. In the event of ambiguous results or lack of clear evidence, the question will resolve as No. If no such event is publicly documented by the resolution date, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will an international AI ethics board be established to regulate AI development and usage by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, an international AI ethics board is officially formed and recognized by at least five of the following entities: the United Nations (UN), the European Union (EU), the United States, China, India, Russia, and Japan. The board must be tasked with creating guidelines, standards, or regulations for the development and usage of artificial intelligence technologies on a global scale. The formation of the board must be documented by at least two reputable global news organizations. In the event that multiple boards are established, the question will resolve as Yes only if there is a consensus among the aforementioned entities to recognize a single board as the primary international regulatory body. If no such board is established, or if there is no consensus on a primary board by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Japan launch a manned mission to the Moon before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2030, the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) or any other official Japanese space agency or government-sponsored private entity successfully launches a mission with at least one Japanese astronaut aboard that lands on the lunar surface and returns safely to Earth. The mission must be primarily funded and operated by Japan, though international collaboration is permitted. The astronaut(s) must perform at least one extravehicular activity (EVA) on the Moon. The resolution will rely on official statements from JAXA, live mission coverage, or other reputable space exploration authorities. In the event of a mission launch scheduled before the resolution date but with a lunar landing after this date, the question will resolve as No unless the landing occurs before the resolution date.

title: Will DeepMind develop an AI capable of managing a space mission's trajectory more efficiently than current systems by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, DeepMind has developed an artificial intelligence (AI) system that demonstrates the ability to manage a space mission's trajectory more efficiently than the best existing systems as of January 1, 2023. Efficiency will be measured in terms of fuel consumption, time to destination, and safety margins. The AI's performance must be validated through a peer-reviewed study, an official statement from a recognized space agency (e.g., NASA, ESA, Roscosmos), or a credible news report confirming the AI's capabilities and its comparison to current systems. The AI must have been actively used in a space mission, whether in simulation or actual spaceflight, and the results must be publicly disclosed. In the event that no such AI is developed by DeepMind, or if the AI developed does not meet the above criteria, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the NBA host a promotional event in space before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the National Basketball Association (NBA) officially hosts a promotional event in a location that is recognized as space by the Fédération Aéronautique Internationale (FAI), which defines space as beginning at the Kármán line, 100 kilometers above Earth's sea level. The event must be sanctioned by the NBA and involve at least one NBA player or team. The event can include, but is not limited to, a basketball game, skills challenge, or a meet-and-greet with fans. The event must be documented and publicly announced by the NBA through official channels such as a press release, official website, or social media accounts. In the case that the NBA merges with or is acquired by another organization, the event must still be associated with the NBA brand. If the event is planned but not executed due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., technical failures, weather conditions), the question will resolve as No. If there is ambiguity regarding the location of the event, the FAI's current definition at the time of the event will be used to determine if the event took place in space.

title: Will there be a significant increase in the number of nuclear reactors in Sweden by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the number of operational nuclear reactors in Sweden has increased by at least 25% compared to the number recorded on January 1, 2021. The count of nuclear reactors will include both commercial power reactors and research reactors that are capable of sustained nuclear fission. Reactors under construction or planned will not be considered unless they have achieved first criticality and are connected to the grid. The official source for the reactor count will be the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) Power Reactor Information System (PRIS) database or its successor. In the event that the IAEA PRIS database is no longer available or updated, the resolution will be based on the most authoritative source available at the time. If the increase is exactly 25%, the question will resolve as Yes. If there is a decrease or no change in the number of reactors, or if the increase is less than 25%, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the US dollar be used in more than 50% of international transactions for nuclear technology by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, according to the data from the Bank for International Settlements (BIS) or an equivalent authoritative financial institution, the US dollar is used in more than 50% of all recorded international transactions related to nuclear technology by the end of 2025. Transactions include but are not limited to the sale, purchase, and trade of nuclear reactors, nuclear fuel, and nuclear technology services. The data must be publicly available and verifiable. In the absence of data from BIS or an equivalent institution, credible financial reports from major global banks involved in nuclear technology transactions will be considered. If no reliable data is available by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new nuclear technology emerge by 2025 that significantly reduces the risk of infectious disease spread through radiation exposure?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new nuclear technology has been developed and demonstrated to significantly reduce the risk of infectious disease spread through radiation exposure. The technology must meet the following criteria:

1. Peer-Reviewed Publication: The technology must be described in a peer-reviewed scientific publication, confirming its efficacy and safety.

2. Official Recognition: The technology must be recognized by a reputable international body such as the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) or the World Health Organization (WHO) as a significant advancement in reducing infectious disease spread through radiation exposure.

3. Practical Deployment: There must be evidence of the technology's deployment in at least one nuclear facility, with documented results showing a reduction in the risk of infectious disease spread.

4. Expert Consensus: A panel of experts in the field of nuclear safety and infectious diseases must reach a consensus that the technology represents a significant improvement over existing methods.

In the absence of such a technology, the question will resolve as No. If the technology emerges but does not meet all the above criteria by the resolution date, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will South Korea develop a nationally-backed cryptocurrency by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the government of South Korea has officially launched a digital currency that is recognized as legal tender within the country. The digital currency must be blockchain-based or utilize similar distributed ledger technology and be endorsed by the Bank of Korea or another relevant national financial authority. The currency must be available for use by the general public and not restricted to interbank or governmental transactions. In the event of a declaration of intent without an actual launch, or if the project is in a pilot or testing phase without full public availability, the question will resolve as No. If there is ambiguity regarding the status of the cryptocurrency due to conflicting reports or lack of clear governmental communication, the question will resolve using the most authoritative and recent statement or evidence from the Bank of Korea or the South Korean Ministry of Economy and Finance.

title: Will Tesla accept Bitcoin as a payment method for its vehicles in Spain before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, Tesla officially announces and implements the acceptance of Bitcoin as a payment method for purchasing its vehicles in Spain. The announcement must be verifiable through Tesla's official communication channels, such as press releases, official social media accounts, or statements from Tesla's executive team. The implementation must be confirmed by the availability of Bitcoin as a payment option on Tesla's Spanish website or through direct confirmation from Tesla's sales representatives in Spain. This resolution criteria exclude temporary promotions or pilot programs unless they result in a permanent change to Tesla's payment options in Spain. In the event of conflicting reports or lack of clear public information, the resolution will be based on the most authoritative and reliable sources available at the time of the resolution date.

title: Will Scott Alexander write a blog post analyzing the impact of cryptocurrencies on global economics before 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Scott Alexander writes and publishes a blog post specifically analyzing the impact of cryptocurrencies on global economics before January 1, 2024. The blog post must be publicly accessible and contain a comprehensive analysis that includes historical data, current trends, and potential future implications of cryptocurrencies on the global economy. The post must be authored by Scott Alexander and published on a platform recognized for hosting his writings, such as his personal blog or a reputable online publication. The resolution will rely on direct evidence of the blog post's existence, such as a URL link or an archived version of the post. In the event of ambiguity regarding the authorship or content focus, a consensus of Metaculus Admins or a designated expert panel will make the final determination. Posts that only briefly mention cryptocurrencies in a broader economic context without in-depth analysis will not meet the resolution criteria.

title: Will the Russo-Ukrainian War lead to a significant technological advancement in cyber warfare by the end of 2023?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, there is a widely recognized breakthrough in cyber warfare technology that can be directly attributed to the Russo-Ukrainian War. The breakthrough must represent a significant advancement over the existing state of the art as of January 2023 and must be acknowledged as such by at least three of the following entities: The United States Cyber Command (USCYBERCOM), The National Security Agency (NSA), The European Union Agency for Cybersecurity (ENISA), or equivalent authoritative bodies in the field of cybersecurity. The advancement must be publicly documented in at least two reputable technology or defense publications. In the absence of such recognition, the question will resolve as No. If the war ends before December 31, 2023, and no such advancement has been recognized by that time, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will there be a breakthrough in engineering that allows for the construction of a building over 2,000 meters tall by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a verifiable report or announcement by a recognized authority in the field of engineering or architecture (such as the Council on Tall Buildings and Urban Habitat or a similar authoritative body) that a building measuring over 2,000 meters in height has been successfully designed, with the construction process either underway or completed. The building must be intended for regular occupation or use, not solely for the purpose of setting a record. The design must be feasible with existing or realistically projected technology, and the project must have secured the necessary funding and regulatory approvals to commence construction. In the event of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the preponderance of evidence from credible sources. If no such building has been reported by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new medical technology for non-invasively monitoring glucose levels receive FDA approval by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has granted approval to a new medical technology that enables non-invasive monitoring of glucose levels in humans. The technology must allow for continuous or spot measurement of glucose without the need for blood samples or skin penetration. The approval must be for a device or system that is marketed and available for use by the general public or healthcare professionals. The FDA's official announcement or database listing will serve as the authoritative source for confirmation. In the event that the FDA is dissolved or its functions are transferred to another entity, the approval must come from the successor organization responsible for medical device regulation. If no such technology is approved by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Microsoft be involved in a major political scandal related to privacy issues before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Microsoft Corporation is implicated in a political scandal that meets the following criteria:

- The scandal must involve a breach of privacy laws or ethical standards related to user data handling, surveillance, or personal information misuse.

- The event must be widely reported by at least three major news outlets, such as The New York Times, The Guardian, or Reuters.

- There must be an official investigation by a governmental body, such as the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) or the European Data Protection Supervisor (EDPS), with findings that confirm Microsoft's involvement.

- The scandal must have significant political repercussions, such as legislative changes, high-profile resignations, or public protests.

In the absence of an official investigation, a unanimous decision by a panel of three independent experts in privacy law and digital ethics, whose selection has been approved by Metaculus Admins, can also confirm the resolution as Yes.

If Microsoft splits into separate entities or undergoes a major rebranding, the entity inheriting the majority of the original company's digital services will be considered for the resolution of this question.

title: Will the US House of Representatives pass a significant piece of legislation regarding online privacy by the end of 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the US House of Representatives passes a bill that meets the following criteria:

- The bill is focused primarily on the protection of online privacy for individuals.
- The bill includes provisions that significantly change the way personal data is collected, used, stored, or shared by companies or other entities.
- The bill must be applicable to a wide range of online activities and platforms, not limited to a specific sector or type of data.
- The bill should introduce new regulatory measures or substantially amend existing laws in a way that enhances privacy protections.
- The bill must be passed by a majority vote in the US House of Representatives and must be signed into law by the President of the United States or otherwise become law.

In the event that multiple bills are passed, the one with the most comprehensive and stringent privacy protections will be considered for resolution. If the status of the legislation is unclear or contested as of the resolution date, the question will resolve as No until official confirmation is provided by the Congressional Record or a statement from the Speaker of the House.

title: Will Canada implement a nationwide carbon tax by the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Government of Canada has passed legislation that imposes a carbon tax on greenhouse gas emissions across all provinces and territories of Canada. The tax must be applicable to individuals, businesses, and organizations, and must be in effect nationwide. The resolution will be based on official statements from the Government of Canada, legislative documents, or national news outlets recognized by the Canadian Press. In the event of a partial implementation or a commitment without actual enforcement, the question will resolve as No. If the tax is repealed or not enforced by the resolution date, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will President Joe Biden announce a new federal initiative focused on advancing quantum computing technology before the end of 2023?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2023, President Joe Biden or an official White House spokesperson announces a new federal initiative specifically aimed at advancing quantum computing technology. The announcement must be made through official channels, such as a White House press release, a presidential speech, or an official statement on the White House website. The initiative must be new and not a continuation or rebranding of existing programs. The announcement must include a clear description of the goals, scope, and funding dedicated to the initiative. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In the event that President Joe Biden is no longer in office before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No unless the acting or new president makes a comparable announcement.

title: Will there be a significant breakthrough in COVID-19 treatment technology that reduces hospitalization rates by at least 50% before 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a treatment technology for COVID-19 is developed and publicly announced that achieves the following: 

- A reduction in hospitalization rates by at least 50% compared to the best available treatment as of January 1, 2023. 

- The reduction must be demonstrated in a peer-reviewed study with a sample size of at least 1,000 patients. 

- The study must be conducted by an organization with no financial interest in the treatment. 

- The results must be replicated independently by at least one other peer-reviewed study. 

- The treatment must receive Emergency Use Authorization by the FDA or a similar regulatory body in at least two G7 countries. 

- In the event that no treatment meets these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will California implement a state-wide technology-driven environmental monitoring system by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the State of California has officially implemented a state-wide environmental monitoring system that utilizes technology for data collection and analysis. The system must be capable of monitoring at least the following environmental factors: air quality, water quality, soil health, and wildlife populations. The implementation is confirmed through a public announcement by a state authority, such as the California Environmental Protection Agency (CalEPA) or the Office of Environmental Health Hazard Assessment (OEHHA), or through legislative action. The system should be operational and actively collecting data. In the event of partial implementation, the question will resolve as Yes only if the system covers at least 75% of the state's territory and includes all four specified environmental factors. If the system is implemented but does not cover all the specified factors or the required territory, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the valuation of the European soccer market exceed $30 billion by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, according to the annual review by Deloitte or a similar authoritative financial services firm, the total market valuation of European soccer, including club valuations, broadcasting rights, sponsorships, and merchandise sales, exceeds $30 billion at any point before December 31, 2025. The valuation must be based on publicly available financial data and reports. In the absence of a report by Deloitte or a similar firm, the resolution will be based on the most credible financial data available from recognized industry analysts or financial news outlets. If no such data can be obtained by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. Currency fluctuations will be considered, and the valuation must exceed $30 billion in USD, using the exchange rate at the time of the reported valuation.

title: Will China's GDP growth rate surpass 6% in any year before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, according to the National Bureau of Statistics of China or the International Monetary Fund (IMF), the annual Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth rate of China reaches or exceeds 6% in any fiscal year before January 1, 2025. The GDP growth rate is to be measured in real terms, adjusted for inflation, and should be reported as an annual percentage increase from the previous year. If both the National Bureau of Statistics of China and the IMF release conflicting reports, the figure provided by the National Bureau of Statistics of China will take precedence. In the event that neither organization provides a clear figure by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will South Korea's exports of semiconductors exceed $200 billion in any year before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, according to the official trade statistics released by the Korea International Trade Association (KITA) or any successor organization, the total annual value of semiconductor exports from South Korea exceeds $200 billion USD in any fiscal year before December 31, 2030. The value should be calculated based on the exchange rate at the time of the official report's release. In the event that KITA is dissolved or ceases to publish trade statistics, the resolution will be based on data from the most authoritative source available at that time, such as the Bank of Korea or the Ministry of Trade, Industry and Energy. If no official data is available by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. Adjustments for inflation or changes in accounting standards over time are not to be considered for the resolution of this question.

title: Will a cryptocurrency blog or publication authored by Scott Alexander mention a specific cryptocurrency as a significant investment opportunity before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a cryptocurrency blog or publication authored by Scott Alexander explicitly mentions a specific cryptocurrency as a significant investment opportunity. The mention must be in the form of a dedicated article or a substantial section within an article, not merely a passing comment. The article must be publicly accessible and verifiable. In the event that Scott Alexander is no longer able to author publications, the question will resolve as No. If Scott Alexander mentions multiple cryptocurrencies, the first instance will be used for resolution. The term 'significant investment opportunity' implies a strong endorsement or recommendation based on potential financial gain, as opposed to a general discussion of the cryptocurrency's technology or ecosystem.

title: Will the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approve a cryptocurrency platform for tracking pharmaceuticals by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has granted approval to at least one cryptocurrency platform specifically for the purpose of tracking pharmaceuticals. Approval is defined as a formal announcement by the FDA or publication in the Federal Register confirming the authorization of the platform's use within the pharmaceutical supply chain. The platform must utilize blockchain or distributed ledger technology to track the production, distribution, and verification of pharmaceutical products. The resolution will rely on official statements from the FDA or credible news reports from established media outlets. In the event that the FDA announces its intention to approve such a platform but the formal approval process is not completed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a cryptocurrency be officially adopted for transactions by a major tennis tournament by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any of the four Grand Slam tennis tournaments (Australian Open, French Open, Wimbledon, or US Open) officially adopts a cryptocurrency as a means of payment for ticket sales, concessions, merchandise, or player compensation. Official adoption is defined as the tournament's organizing body or host venue publicly announcing and implementing the use of a cryptocurrency for at least one of the aforementioned transaction types. The cryptocurrency must be a decentralized digital currency (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum) and not a digital payment system or e-money (e.g., PayPal, WeChat Pay). The resolution will be based on credible media reports, official press releases, or direct confirmation from the tournament's organizing body. In the event of a temporary adoption (e.g., for a promotional event), the cryptocurrency must be used for transactions for the entire duration of one tournament to count towards resolution. If no such adoption occurs, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the US Congress pass a bill specifically regulating stablecoins by the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by 11:59 PM U.S. Eastern Time on December 31, 2024, the United States Congress has passed federal legislation that explicitly regulates stablecoins. The bill must be signed into law by the President of the United States or otherwise become law. The legislation must specifically address the definition, usage, and/or oversight of stablecoins, which are digital currencies designed to maintain a stable value relative to a specified asset, or a basket of assets, such as fiat currency or commodities. The resolution will be based on credible media reports, official government publications, or direct announcements from the U.S. Congress or the President's office. If no bill is passed, or if a bill is passed but does not become law, or if the bill does not specifically regulate stablecoins, the question will resolve as No. In the event of ambiguity or lack of clarity regarding the bill's provisions on stablecoins, the resolution will default to No unless an authoritative clarification is provided by the U.S. Congress or a recognized legal authority.

title: Will Australia establish a central bank digital currency (CBDC) for public use by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) or any other official Australian governmental body has successfully launched a central bank digital currency (CBDC) that is accessible to the general public for regular transactions. The CBDC must be a digital form of the Australian dollar, recognized as legal tender, and must be usable for both online and offline transactions. The launch of the CBDC must be confirmed through an official statement or press release by the RBA or the relevant governmental body. Pilot programs, trials, or research initiatives will not be considered sufficient for resolution unless they transition into a fully operational public service. In the event of ambiguity regarding the status of the CBDC, the question will be resolved based on the most authoritative public information available from the RBA or the Australian government.

title: Will a COVID-19 vaccine be distributed on a blockchain platform to enhance traceability by the end of 2023?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, there is verifiable evidence that a COVID-19 vaccine has been distributed using a blockchain platform with the primary purpose of enhancing traceability. The evidence must include official statements or reports from the vaccine manufacturer, healthcare providers, or government health agencies confirming the use of blockchain technology for the distribution and traceability of the vaccine. The blockchain platform must be a distributed ledger system that is publicly accessible or auditable by relevant health authorities. The resolution will not consider internal or proprietary databases that are not based on blockchain technology. In the event of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the preponderance of evidence from credible sources. If no credible evidence is available by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Russo-Ukrainian War lead to a significant delay in a Russian space mission before 2025?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, any Russian space mission with a planned launch date prior to January 1, 2025, is officially delayed by at least six months from its originally scheduled launch date, as confirmed by an official statement from Roscosmos or a credible news source. A 'significant delay' is defined as a postponement of six months or more from the initially planned launch date. The delay must be explicitly attributed to the Russo-Ukrainian War by the official source. If no such delay is confirmed, or if the delay is attributed to other causes such as technical issues, budget constraints, or international sanctions not directly related to the war, the question will resolve as No. In the event that Roscosmos is dissolved or restructured, the successor organization's official statements will be considered authoritative. If no authoritative source provides a clear statement regarding the delay and its causes by the resolution date, the question will resolve as ambiguous.

title: Will a robot designed for space repairs complete a mission outside of the Earth's atmosphere before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a robot specifically designed for space repairs completes a mission outside of Earth's atmosphere. The mission must involve the robot performing at least one repair task on a satellite, space station, or other human-made object in space. The task must be completed autonomously or with minimal human intervention, and the robot must demonstrate the ability to navigate and manipulate objects in the zero-gravity environment of space.

The mission must be verified by an authoritative space agency such as NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, or an equivalent organization. The verification should include evidence of the mission's objectives, the robot's tasks, and the successful completion of the repair.

In the event that multiple robots complete missions, the resolution will be based on the first verified completion. If no robot completes a mission by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If the mission is completed but not verified by an authoritative source by the resolution date, the question will resolve as ambiguous and may be subject to review upon later verification.

title: Will Canada announce a new space mission involving a partnership with a private space company before 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the Canadian Space Agency (CSA) or any official Canadian government body publicly announces a new space mission that involves a partnership with one or more private space companies. The announcement must specify the nature of the partnership, the objectives of the mission, and the roles of the involved parties. The mission may involve any aspect of space exploration, including but not limited to satellite deployment, scientific research, space station construction, or lunar exploration.

For the purposes of this question, a 'private space company' is defined as any non-governmental entity that offers space-related services or technologies. The company must be clearly identified as a partner in the mission, and its participation must be confirmed by both the CSA and the company itself through official channels such as press releases, official statements, or government records.

In the event that an announcement is made but the mission is subsequently canceled or indefinitely postponed before the resolution date, the question will still resolve as Yes, provided that the initial announcement met all the criteria specified above. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Israel launch a manned mission to the Moon before 2040?
