title: Will Google integrate a cryptocurrency wallet into its suite of services by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Google has officially integrated a cryptocurrency wallet into any of its existing services or has launched a new service that includes a cryptocurrency wallet. The integration must allow users to store, send, or receive cryptocurrency within the Google ecosystem. The resolution will be based on public announcements from Google or verifiable evidence of the service being available to the general public. If Google announces the integration but it is not available to users by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In the event that Google is acquired or undergoes a significant rebranding that affects its service offerings, the question will resolve based on the actions of the successor entity. If there is ambiguity regarding the definition of 'cryptocurrency wallet' or 'integration,' the resolution will defer to the most widely accepted standards in the cryptocurrency industry at the time of the resolution.

title: Will the James Webb Space Telescope discover a new exoplanet with potential signs of life by 2030?
body:
The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) team or a peer-reviewed scientific publication confirms the discovery of an exoplanet with the following characteristics:

- The exoplanet must be located outside our solar system.
- It must orbit within the habitable zone of its star, where liquid water could exist on the planet's surface.
- There must be detectable signs of life, such as atmospheric bio-signatures or other indicators of biological activity, as recognized by the scientific community.
- The discovery must be made using data collected by the JWST, and the results must be verifiable by independent researchers.

In the event that the JWST is no longer operational, the resolution will be based on the last available data collected by the telescope prior to its discontinuation. If the JWST program is terminated before 2030 without a successor telescope capable of similar observations, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Russia successfully launch a manned mission to the Moon by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Russian space agency Roscosmos, or any other Russian entity, successfully launches and completes a manned mission to the Moon. A mission is considered successful if it includes a safe launch, Moon landing, and return of the crew to Earth. The crew must perform at least one extravehicular activity (EVA) on the Moon's surface. The resolution will rely on official statements from Roscosmos, corroborated by at least two independent space industry authorities. In the event of a dispute regarding the mission's success, the resolution will default to the judgment of the International Astronautical Federation (IAF). If no mission is launched, or if a mission is launched but fails to meet the above criteria, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will researchers find evidence of microbial life on Mars by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a peer-reviewed scientific publication or an official announcement by a recognized space agency (e.g., NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, ISRO) that provides direct evidence of microbial life on Mars. Direct evidence may include, but is not limited to, the detection of microorganisms, microbial fossils, or unambiguous chemical biosignatures indicative of life. Indirect evidence or hypotheses without direct physical proof will not be considered sufficient. In the event of a dispute over the findings, a panel of experts in astrobiology or a similar field, agreed upon by Metaculus Admins, will be consulted to determine the validity of the claim. If no such evidence is presented or confirmed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the European Union introduce a new member state before the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by 31 December 2025, at least one new country is officially admitted and recognized as a member state of the European Union (EU). Official admission is defined as the completion of the accession process, including the signing of the Treaty of Accession, ratification by the existing EU member states, and the formal granting of EU membership status to the new member state. The resolution will be based on official announcements from the European Council, the European Commission, or other authoritative EU bodies. In the event of ambiguity or dispute over the status of a new member state, the resolution will default to the most recent official statement or document provided by the European Council or the European Commission. If no new member state is admitted by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Major League Baseball (MLB) implement a policy addressing political endorsements by players before the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2024, Major League Baseball (MLB) officially adopts a policy that explicitly addresses political endorsements by players. The policy must be documented and publicly announced by MLB through official channels such as a press release, official website publication, or a public statement by an authorized MLB representative. The policy must specifically mention political endorsements and outline the stance of MLB regarding such endorsements, whether it be allowing, restricting, prohibiting, or otherwise regulating them. The resolution will not consider informal guidelines or private communications as an official policy. In the event that MLB is dissolved or undergoes a significant restructuring that makes it unrecognizable in its current form, the question will resolve as No. If no such policy is announced by the resolution date, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will the US dollar cease to be the world's primary reserve currency by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any of the following conditions are met:

The International Monetary Fund (IMF) reports that the US dollar constitutes less than 50% of global foreign exchange reserves.

The Bank for International Settlements (BIS) or the World Bank publishes data showing that the majority of international trade settlements are routinely conducted in a currency other than the US dollar.

A resolution by the United Nations or a similar international body officially recognizes a currency other than the US dollar as the world's primary reserve currency.

In the event that the IMF, BIS, World Bank, or United Nations cease to exist or no longer publish relevant data, a reputable financial institution or consortium of financial experts, agreed upon by Metaculus Admins, will be consulted for the determination of the primary reserve currency status.

Edge cases, such as temporary fluctuations or the emergence of a basket of currencies that does not include the US dollar as the majority component, will not be considered as meeting the resolution criteria.

title: Will Russia implement a new form of government replacing the current presidential system by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Russian Federation officially adopts a new form of government that is not a presidential system, as defined by the current Constitution of the Russian Federation (as of 2023). The new form of government must be substantively different and not merely a rebranding or minor modification of the existing presidential system. 

The change must be recognized and reported by at least three of the following authoritative sources: The United Nations, the Council of Europe, the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE), or major international news organizations such as Reuters, BBC, or The New York Times. 

In the event that the Russian Federation ceases to exist as a sovereign entity or undergoes a significant territorial change, the question will resolve as No unless a new form of government replacing the presidential system is established and recognized across the majority of the former Russian Federation's recognized territory prior to the change. 

If there is ambiguity regarding the implementation of a new government form due to political instability, lack of clear international recognition, or conflicting reports, the question will resolve as No unless clear evidence is provided by the aforementioned authoritative sources by the resolution date.

title: Will a major political theory or philosophy emerge and gain substantial international influence by 2030?
body: A 'major political theory or philosophy' is defined as a new framework or system of political thought that has not been significantly discussed prior to 2021. It must be recognized and analyzed in at least 10 peer-reviewed academic publications in the field of political science or philosophy. Additionally, it must be explicitly endorsed or implemented as a guiding principle by at least one nation-state or by a political organization with representation in multiple nation-states. The influence of the theory or philosophy must be evident through legislative, policy, or social changes that are directly attributed to its principles. In the event of ambiguity, a panel of five experts from top global universities in political science or philosophy will be consulted to determine if the criteria have been met. The decision of the panel will be considered final.

title: Will NASA successfully conduct a manned mission to Mars before 2040?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if NASA successfully lands at least one human astronaut on the surface of Mars and the astronaut safely returns to Earth before January 1, 2040. A mission will be considered successful if it meets the following criteria:

- The mission is conducted by NASA, either independently or in collaboration with other space agencies or private entities.
- The astronaut must physically walk on the surface of Mars.
- The mission includes a safe return trip to Earth, with the astronaut surviving the journey back.

The resolution will be based on official NASA announcements, live broadcasts, or confirmations from recognized international space agencies. In the event of a dispute or ambiguity regarding the mission's success, the resolution will default to the most recent and credible information available from authoritative scientific publications or expert consensus.

title: Will Brazil deploy a national AI strategy for improving public healthcare by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Brazilian government has officially announced and begun the implementation of a national strategy that utilizes artificial intelligence (AI) to enhance public healthcare services. The strategy must include specific initiatives aimed at improving patient outcomes, reducing costs, or increasing efficiency within the public healthcare system. The announcement must be verifiable through official government channels or statements from the Ministry of Health. In the event of ambiguity or partial implementation, the question will resolve as Yes only if the core objectives of the strategy are actively being pursued in practice, as evidenced by government reports or credible media coverage. If no official strategy is announced or if the strategy announced does not specifically target public healthcare improvements through AI, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an AI system be used to coach a professional basketball team during an official game by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, an AI system has been used to perform the role of head coach or assistant coach during at least one official game of a professional basketball league recognized by FIBA. The AI must make strategic decisions such as player substitutions, play calling, and timeout management without human intervention during the game. The use of the AI system must be documented and confirmed by the league's official records or a statement from the team. If the AI system is used in a coaching capacity but does not have full autonomy in decision-making, the question will resolve as No. In the event that the professional basketball season is disrupted or cancelled, the resolution date may be extended to the end of the following season.

title: Will the Biden administration implement a policy requiring AI ethics review for federal AI projects before the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Biden administration has officially announced and implemented a policy that mandates an ethics review for all federal AI projects. The policy must be applicable to all federal agencies and must include a clear set of guidelines for conducting the ethics review. The policy should address at least the following aspects of AI ethics: data privacy, algorithmic bias, transparency, and accountability. The announcement of the policy can be through an executive order, federal regulation, or an official statement from the White House. The implementation of the policy must be evidenced by the initiation of ethics reviews in at least three different federal agencies, with at least one project in each agency undergoing the review process. If the Biden administration is succeeded before the end of 2024, the resolution will be based on the policies in place as of the last day of the administration. In the event that no official policy is announced, but an executive order or similar directive leads to the widespread adoption of ethics reviews in practice, the question will resolve as Yes if the practice is consistent with the described criteria and is in effect across multiple federal agencies by the resolution date.

title: Will North Korea launch a satellite into orbit that is recognized by international space agencies before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (North Korea) successfully launches a satellite into Earth's orbit, and the following conditions are met:

- The satellite must complete at least one full orbit around the Earth.

- The launch and the satellite's orbital status must be independently verified by at least two of the following space agencies: NASA (United States), ESA (European Space Agency), Roscosmos (Russia), CNSA (China National Space Administration), or ISRO (Indian Space Research Organisation).

- The satellite must be intended for peaceful purposes, as stated by North Korean officials and corroborated by at least one of the verifying space agencies.

- In the event that international space agencies do not provide explicit recognition, the satellite's orbital status must be confirmed by credible astronomical institutions or by evidence from tracking data provided by an established satellite tracking service.

- If the satellite is launched but fails to achieve orbit, or if the satellite is not recognized due to geopolitical disputes, the question will resolve as No.

- If North Korea announces a launch and no independent verification is possible by the resolution date, the question will resolve as Ambiguous.

title: Will Australia commit to a manned lunar mission by 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, the Australian government, or a recognized space agency or private spaceflight company based in Australia, officially announces and commits to conducting a manned lunar mission. The commitment must include a clear statement of intent to send at least one Australian astronaut to the lunar surface, along with a planned timeline for the mission's launch. The announcement must be verifiable through official government channels, press releases, or major media outlets. In the event of ambiguity or partial commitments, the question will resolve as No unless there is an unequivocal declaration of a manned lunar mission. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an environmental science satellite dedicated to monitoring climate change be launched by a private space company before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a private space company successfully launches a satellite with the primary mission of monitoring climate change. The satellite must be equipped with instruments capable of measuring at least three of the following: atmospheric temperature, sea level rise, greenhouse gas concentrations, ice sheet dynamics, or deforestation rates. The launch and the satellite's capabilities must be confirmed by a recognized space industry authority, such as the United Nations Office for Outer Space Affairs (UNOOSA) or the International Astronautical Federation (IAF). In the event that multiple satellites are launched, only the first satellite that meets these criteria will be considered for resolution. If no such satellite is launched by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In the case of ambiguity or disputes regarding the satellite's primary mission or capabilities, a panel of three independent experts in the field of environmental science and space technology will be convened to make a final determination.

title: Will Germany implement a nationwide policy specifically regulating the use of genetic engineering in humans by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the German government has enacted and brought into force a nationwide policy that explicitly regulates the use of genetic engineering in humans. The policy must be applicable across the entire country and not limited to specific regions or states within Germany.

The policy must address at least one of the following aspects of genetic engineering in humans:

- Ethical guidelines for genetic modification procedures.
- Legal framework for research and application of genetic engineering.
- Standards and certifications required for facilities and practitioners performing genetic modifications.
- Patient consent and rights in the context of genetic engineering.

The resolution will be based on official publications or announcements by the German government, such as legislative texts, official press releases, or statements from relevant government officials. In the absence of direct government communication, credible news reports from established media outlets may be used to confirm the implementation of such a policy.

If multiple policies are implemented, the one with the broadest scope will be considered for resolution. If a policy is passed but not implemented by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In the event of ambiguity or lack of clear evidence, the question will remain unresolved until sufficient information becomes available.

title: Will Germany announce the commencement of a major public infrastructure project involving significant engineering advancements by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the German government or any of its federal states officially announces the commencement of a major public infrastructure project that includes significant engineering advancements. The project must meet the following criteria:

- The project is publicly announced by an official government source, such as a press release, official statement, or government spokesperson.

- The project involves the construction, upgrade, or expansion of physical infrastructure, such as transportation networks, energy systems, or public buildings.

- The project incorporates significant engineering advancements, which are defined as novel technologies or methods that represent a substantial improvement over existing solutions in terms of efficiency, sustainability, or functionality. Examples include, but are not limited to, the use of smart materials, automation in construction processes, or innovative energy solutions.

- The project has a planned or actual start date within six months of the announcement.

In the event that multiple projects are announced, the resolution will be based on the first project that meets all the above criteria.

If no such project is announced by the specified date, or if the project announced does not meet the criteria outlined above, the question will resolve as No.

In case of ambiguity regarding the significance of the engineering advancements, a panel of three experts in the field of civil engineering, appointed by Metaculus Admins, will determine whether the project meets the criteria. Their decision will be considered final for the purpose of resolving this question.

title: Will a political party with a platform focused on advancing genetic engineering policies win a majority in the German Bundestag by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by 23:59:59 on December 31, 2030, a political party with a platform that explicitly prioritizes the advancement of genetic engineering policies secures a majority of the seats in the German Bundestag following a federal election. The party must have a clear and public commitment to genetic engineering in its official platform, as evidenced by its manifesto or official statements by its leadership. The resolution will be based on the official election results as reported by the Federal Returning Officer of Germany (Bundeswahlleiter). In the event of a coalition government where the leading party meets the criteria, the question will resolve as Yes only if that party holds the majority of the coalition's total seats. If no party meeting the criteria wins a majority, or if the Bundestag is dissolved without such a party winning a majority by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a COVID-19 vaccine be developed that also provides immunity against specific nuclear radiation-induced illnesses by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a COVID-19 vaccine has been developed and is publicly available that also provides immunity against illnesses induced by specific types of nuclear radiation. The vaccine must meet the following criteria:

- Efficacy: The vaccine must demonstrate at least 50% efficacy in preventing COVID-19 as well as a statistically significant efficacy in preventing illnesses caused by nuclear radiation, as compared to a placebo.

- Approval: The vaccine must receive approval from a major health authority such as the World Health Organization (WHO), the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA), or the European Medicines Agency (EMA).

- Peer-Reviewed Research: The vaccine's effects must be documented in at least one peer-reviewed scientific journal.

- Availability: The vaccine must be available to the general public, with production and distribution confirmed by the manufacturing company or health authorities.

In the event that no vaccine meeting these criteria is developed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If multiple vaccines meet the criteria, the first vaccine to receive approval will be considered for resolution.

title: Will NATO establish a dedicated nuclear incident response team by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, NATO has officially announced the establishment of a dedicated nuclear incident response team. The team must be operational and have a clear mandate to respond to nuclear incidents, which may include accidents, unauthorized use of nuclear materials, or nuclear attacks. The announcement must specify the team's capabilities, jurisdiction, and the resources allocated to it. The resolution will rely on official NATO press releases, statements from NATO officials, or NATO documentation. In the absence of a clear announcement by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. If NATO is disbanded or undergoes significant restructuring that makes the establishment of such a team irrelevant or impossible, the question will resolve as N/A (Not Applicable).

title: Will Mexico develop its own nuclear power plant by 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, the government of Mexico has officially announced the completion and operational status of a nuclear power plant within its territory. The plant must be capable of generating nuclear energy for public or industrial use and must have passed all necessary safety and regulatory inspections by the relevant Mexican authorities or international bodies such as the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA). The announcement must be verifiable through official government channels, credible news outlets, or direct confirmation from the IAEA. In the event of ambiguity regarding the plant's operational status, the question will resolve as No unless there is clear evidence of the plant producing energy for the grid. If the plant is announced but not operational by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will OpenAI release a space exploration-related AI model by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, OpenAI has officially released an AI model that is specifically designed for and publicly marketed as aiding in space exploration tasks. The model must demonstrate capabilities in at least one of the following areas: satellite imagery analysis, spacecraft navigation, or astronaut assistance during space missions. The release must be confirmed through an official OpenAI announcement or press release. In the event that OpenAI is dissolved or rebranded before the resolution date, the question will resolve based on the actions of its successor organization. If no successor exists, the question will resolve as No. If OpenAI merges with another entity, the question will resolve based on the actions of the merged entity. If the model is released in a beta or limited access form before the resolution date but is not generally available to the public, the question will resolve as No unless the model is fully released before the resolution date.

title: Will SpaceX successfully land a reusable launch system on Mars by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if SpaceX successfully lands a reusable launch system on the surface of Mars on or before December 31, 2025. The landing must be confirmed by SpaceX through an official announcement or a press release. Additionally, the event must be verified by at least one of the following authoritative sources: NASA, the European Space Agency (ESA), or an independent space monitoring organization recognized by the International Astronautical Federation (IAF).

The reusable launch system must demonstrate the ability to land intact and be capable of being refurbished for a subsequent mission. The resolution will not consider any subsequent missions or the refurbishment process itself.

In the event of a dispute or ambiguity regarding the landing, the resolution will be based on the consensus of reports from the aforementioned authoritative sources. If no consensus can be reached, the question will resolve as No.

If SpaceX ceases operations or the Mars mission is officially canceled before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new form of energy be utilized for space travel, replacing traditional chemical rockets, by 2040?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, a new form of energy, distinct from traditional chemical rocket propulsion, is used to power a spacecraft for interplanetary travel, and meets the following criteria:

- The spacecraft must complete at least one successful journey between Earth and another celestial body (e.g., the Moon, Mars) using the new energy form as its primary propulsion method.

- The new form of energy must be the main source of propulsion for the spacecraft and must not rely on chemical rockets for more than 10% of the total propulsion throughout the journey.

- The utilization of the new energy form must be confirmed by at least two independent and reputable space agencies or organizations (e.g., NASA, ESA, SpaceX).

- The event must be documented and publicly disclosed through official reports, press releases, or peer-reviewed scientific publications.

In the event that multiple new forms of energy are utilized, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the above criteria.

If no new form of energy is utilized by the specified date, or if the use of such energy does not meet the above criteria, the question will resolve as No.

Fallback scenario: If the journey is underway but not completed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as Yes only if the spacecraft has already demonstrated the new energy form's capability in interplanetary travel without relying on chemical rockets for more than 10% of the journey.

title: Will a testable prediction from string theory be confirmed through space exploration missions by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any of the following criteria are met:

- A space exploration mission, recognized by the International Astronomical Union (IAU) or a similar authoritative body, confirms a prediction unique to string theory that is distinguishable from predictions of other theoretical frameworks.

- A peer-reviewed scientific publication presents empirical evidence from space exploration missions that is widely accepted by the scientific community as a confirmation of a testable prediction from string theory.

- An official statement from a major space agency (e.g., NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, ISRO) or a renowned scientific organization (e.g., the American Physical Society, the Royal Astronomical Society) acknowledges the confirmation of a string theory prediction through space exploration.

In the event that multiple interpretations of the results exist, the resolution will be based on the consensus within the scientific community as reflected in a majority of publications and expert opinions.

If no confirmation is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Ukraine launch its own satellite into space without foreign assistance by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Ukrainian government or any Ukraine-based private entity successfully launches and operates a satellite into Earth's orbit without foreign assistance. 'Foreign assistance' refers to any non-Ukrainian technical, financial, or material support in the design, construction, launch, or operation of the satellite. The satellite must complete at least one full orbit around Earth and transmit data back to a Ukrainian ground station to be considered operational. The launch must be independently verified by an authoritative space agency or organization, such as the United Nations Office for Outer Space Affairs (UNOOSA) or the International Astronomical Union (IAU). In the event of a dispute, the resolution will be based on the consensus of at least three recognized space industry experts. If no launch attempt is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Democratic Party in the US propose a bill dedicated to funding a new space exploration initiative by 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a bill is formally proposed in either the United States House of Representatives or the Senate that allocates federal funds specifically for a new space exploration initiative. The bill must be sponsored by a member of the Democratic Party and must include provisions for funding projects that are not continuations of existing space programs. The bill does not need to be passed into law for this question to resolve as Yes. The proposal of the bill must be verifiable through official congressional records or statements from the Democratic Party. In the event that the status of the bill is unclear or disputed, the resolution will be based on the most authoritative and widely recognized sources available at the time of resolution.

title: Will Brazil have an operational nuclear-powered submarine by 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, the Brazilian Navy has commissioned and has in operational service at least one nuclear-powered submarine. The submarine must be capable of performing military operations and not solely for training or testing purposes. The operational status should be confirmed by official statements from the Brazilian Navy or the Brazilian government, or by credible reporting from established defense or maritime industry publications. If the submarine is operational but restricted from use due to international sanctions, treaties, or environmental concerns, the question will still resolve as Yes. In the event that the Brazilian Navy has a nuclear-powered submarine under construction but not yet operational, or if the status is unclear as of the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will India conduct a thermonuclear weapons test by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the government of India has officially conducted a thermonuclear weapons test, as confirmed by at least two of the following sources: the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty Organization (CTBTO), or the government of India itself. The test must be a deliberate detonation of a thermonuclear device, as opposed to a conventional explosion or a failed test. In the event that official confirmation is not available, the question will resolve as Yes if credible evidence of such a test is reported by at least three major international news organizations (e.g., BBC, CNN, Al Jazeera, Reuters, The New York Times). If there is significant controversy or doubt about the nature of the explosion, the question will resolve as Ambiguous. If no test is conducted or confirmed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a nuclear technology breakthrough lead to a significant increase in the efficiency of energy production for basketball arena lighting by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a publicly documented case of a basketball arena that has implemented a new nuclear technology resulting in at least a 50% increase in energy efficiency specifically for lighting purposes compared to the baseline efficiency of lighting systems as of 2023. The increase in efficiency must be attributable to a breakthrough in nuclear technology, such as advances in nuclear fusion or fission processes, and not merely improvements in lighting technology or energy management systems. The breakthrough must be recognized by a reputable scientific or industry authority, such as the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) or a similar organization. In the event that multiple arenas claim to have achieved this increase, the first documented case will be considered for resolution. If no such case is documented by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In the case of ambiguity or lack of clear documentation, the question will be resolved by a panel of experts in the field of nuclear energy, whose decision will be final.

title: Will OpenAI release a new AI model that significantly outperforms GPT-4 in general intelligence benchmarks by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, OpenAI has released a new AI model that demonstrates a significant improvement over GPT-4 in terms of general intelligence. The criteria for 'significant improvement' will be based on the model's performance in a set of pre-established benchmarks that assess various dimensions of general intelligence, including but not limited to natural language understanding, problem-solving, logical reasoning, and creativity. The benchmarks will be administered by an independent panel of experts in the field of artificial intelligence, and the results must show at least a 15% increase in performance metrics across the majority of the tested areas compared to GPT-4. The benchmarks and their results must be publicly available and verifiable. In the event that OpenAI does not release a new model by the specified date, or if the model's performance does not meet the outlined criteria, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new energy storage technology emerge by 2025 that exceeds the energy density of lithium-ion batteries by at least 50%?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new energy storage technology is publicly announced and verified to have an energy density exceeding that of the best commercially available lithium-ion batteries in 2023 by at least 50%. The energy density must be measured in watt-hours per kilogram (Wh/kg) and must be demonstrated in a fully functioning prototype, not just a theoretical or lab-scale model. The technology must be scalable and show potential for commercial production. Verification can come from peer-reviewed scientific publications, credible industry reports, or announcements from reputable energy research institutions. In the event of multiple claims, the resolution will be based on the consensus of the scientific community or a designated expert panel. If no such technology is announced or if announcements cannot be verified to meet these criteria, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major scientific journal publish a paper by 2025 that provides empirical evidence supporting a prominent philosophical theory of consciousness?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a paper is published in a scientific journal that meets the following criteria:

- The journal must have an impact factor of 5.0 or higher according to the Journal Citation Reports of the year of publication.

- The paper must present empirical evidence that supports a prominent philosophical theory of consciousness, such as Dualism, Physicalism, Panpsychism, or Integrated Information Theory.

- The evidence must be based on experimental data or observations that are peer-reviewed and replicable.

- The paper must be cited by at least three independent researchers in the field of consciousness studies or related disciplines within six months of its publication.

- In the event that multiple theories are supported by different papers, the first paper to be published according to the above criteria will be considered for resolution.

- If no paper is published by the specified date, or if published papers do not meet the above criteria, the question will resolve as No.

- In case of ambiguity or disputes regarding the interpretation of 'prominent philosophical theory of consciousness,' the resolution will defer to the consensus of a panel of three experts in the field, appointed by the Metaculus Admins.

title: Will the global economic impact of COVID-19 vaccine distribution lead to a measurable increase in GDP growth rates in low-income countries by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the World Bank or a similar authoritative economic body reports that the average GDP growth rate for low-income countries, as classified by the World Bank at the time of the report, has increased by at least 0.5 percentage points from the average rate reported for the years 2019-2020. The increase must be attributed, at least in part, to the economic impact of COVID-19 vaccine distribution as determined by the reporting body. In the absence of a direct attribution, a consensus of expert economic analyses may be used to infer the impact of vaccine distribution on GDP growth. If no authoritative report or consensus is available by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will DeepMind develop an AI with the capability to significantly disrupt at least one major industry by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, DeepMind has developed an artificial intelligence (AI) system that has been publicly recognized to significantly disrupt at least one major industry. 'Significant disruption' is defined as causing a major shift in industry practices, business models, or market structures, as reported by at least three reputable industry sources (e.g., Forbes, Bloomberg, The Economist). The AI system must be a primary factor in the disruption, as opposed to a contributing technology among others. The industry in question must be one of the following: healthcare, automotive, finance, entertainment, or energy. Disruption is considered significant if it leads to a change in at least 20% of the market share within the industry or a comparable metric of impact, such as a 20% increase in efficiency or productivity. The resolution will rely on reports and analyses from the specified industry sources published by December 31, 2030. In the absence of clear industry consensus, a panel of experts from the affected industry may be consulted to determine the resolution.

title: Will a major astronomical discovery lead to the creation of a new industry by 2040?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, a discovery in the field of astronomy leads to the establishment of a new industry that meets the following criteria:

- The discovery must be related to a celestial phenomenon or object that was previously unknown or not fully understood.

- The new industry must be directly based on the application or exploitation of the astronomical discovery.

- The industry must have at least 10 companies or entities with a combined market valuation of over $1 billion USD, or equivalent in other currencies, adjusted for inflation to 2023 levels.

- The industry must be recognized as a distinct economic sector by at least two major financial reporting services, such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or similar.

- The industry must have created at least 1,000 jobs globally.

In the event that multiple discoveries lead to the creation of new industries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one industry meets the above criteria.

If the discovery is made but the industry has not reached the specified scale by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

In the case of ambiguity or disputes over whether an industry is 'new' or based on the astronomical discovery, a panel of experts from the International Astronomical Union (IAU) will be consulted for a final decision.

title: Will a space elevator be constructed and become operational by 2050?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2050, a space elevator has been constructed and is operational, as defined by the following criteria:

- Construction Completion: The physical structure of the space elevator, including the base station, tether, and counterweight, must be fully constructed.

- Operational Status: The space elevator must have successfully transported cargo or passengers to and from space at least once.

- Official Confirmation: The operational status must be confirmed by an announcement from the organization responsible for the space elevator's construction or a recognized authority in space exploration, such as NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, or an equivalent organization.

- Public Disclosure: Details of the construction and operational status must be publicly disclosed and verifiable.

In the event that multiple space elevators are constructed, the resolution will be based on the first elevator that meets these criteria. If no space elevator becomes operational by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

Edge Cases: If a space elevator is constructed but not operational due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., legal, environmental, or technical issues), the question will resolve as No. If the operational status is disputed, a panel of experts from at least three different recognized space exploration organizations must confirm the operational status for the question to resolve as Yes.

title: Will a major space agency name a spacecraft or mission after Scott Alexander before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a major space agency such as NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, or ISRO officially names a spacecraft or mission after Scott Alexander. The naming must be confirmed through an official press release or public announcement by the respective agency. In the event of a dispute over what constitutes a 'major' space agency, the decision will be deferred to the Metaculus Admins. If a spacecraft or mission is named after Scott Alexander but the naming is not made public or is retracted before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If no such naming occurs by the resolution date, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will evidence of supersymmetry be discovered in particle physics experiments conducted in space by 2040?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, any of the following conditions are met based on the results of particle physics experiments conducted in space:

1. Detection of particles that are consistent with supersymmetric partners of the Standard Model particles, as confirmed by at least two independent research groups.

2. Observation of phenomena that cannot be explained by the Standard Model alone and are attributed to supersymmetric effects, as recognized by a consensus in the scientific community or a reputable scientific body such as the International Union of Pure and Applied Physics (IUPAP).

3. Publication of peer-reviewed research in a recognized scientific journal that provides empirical evidence supporting the existence of supersymmetry, and this evidence is widely accepted by the particle physics community.

In the event that multiple experiments provide conflicting results, the resolution will be based on the consensus of the majority of the scientific community. If no consensus is reached by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

For the purpose of this question, 'evidence of supersymmetry' refers to empirical data that indicates the presence of new particles or forces that are predicted by supersymmetric theories and are distinct from those described by the Standard Model of particle physics.

title: Will a COVID-19 vaccine be mandated for international travel by any G7 country before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, any of the G7 countries (Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom, or the United States) officially mandates a COVID-19 vaccine for all individuals entering the country for international travel. The mandate must apply to non-citizens and non-residents and must be a requirement for entry as opposed to a recommendation. The resolution will be based on official statements, legislation, or regulations published by the respective government authorities. In the event of temporary measures due to specific outbreaks, only a continuous mandate lasting more than six months will be considered for resolution. If no such mandate is in place by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new variant of COVID-19 lead to a global lockdown similar to that of 2020 before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the World Health Organization (WHO) or a minimum of five national governments officially declare a global lockdown due to a new variant of COVID-19. The lockdown must be comparable in scale and nature to the lockdowns of 2020, affecting at least 50% of the population in the countries involved and including mandatory stay-at-home orders, closure of non-essential businesses, and international travel restrictions. The new variant must be genetically distinct from previous strains and be identified as the primary cause of the lockdown by the declaring authorities. In the absence of an official global lockdown declaration, the question will resolve as No. If the WHO or relevant national health authorities do not provide a clear statement regarding a global lockdown by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Google face antitrust litigation resulting in a company breakup in the United States before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Google (or its parent company Alphabet Inc.) is subjected to antitrust litigation by the United States government that results in a formal court order or a legally binding agreement mandating the breakup of the company into two or more separate entities. The breakup must be due to antitrust concerns and not for other reasons such as voluntary restructuring or unrelated legal matters. The resolution will be based on official court documents, public statements from the U.S. Department of Justice or the Federal Trade Commission, or credible media reports from established news organizations. In the event of a settlement without a breakup, the question will resolve as No, unless the settlement explicitly includes provisions that effectively divide Google's business operations into independent companies. If litigation is ongoing without a resolution by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be an event officially recognized as part of the Olympic Games that takes place in space before 2040?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2040, an event is officially recognized by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) as part of the Olympic Games and is conducted in a location that is not on Earth's surface. The event must meet the following conditions:

- Official Recognition: The event must be announced by the IOC as an official Olympic event, with athletes representing at least three different nations participating.

- Location: The event must take place either in orbit around Earth, on the Moon, or on any other celestial body, as confirmed by the IOC or a space agency such as NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, or any other recognized authority in space exploration.

- Olympic Principles: The event must adhere to the Olympic Charter and embody the values of Olympism, including sportsmanship, fair play, and international cooperation.

- Broadcast and Accessibility: The event must be broadcasted live or recorded for public viewing, and the results must be officially recorded in the Olympic records.

In the event that the IOC is dissolved or the Olympic Games are fundamentally restructured, an equivalent authoritative body's recognition of the event will be considered valid for the resolution of this question.

title: Will a space structure designed for human habitation, larger than the International Space Station, be completed by 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, there is a completed space structure that is designed for human habitation and is larger in total internal volume than the International Space Station (as of 2023). The space structure must be capable of supporting human life for a minimum of 30 consecutive days without resupply from Earth. The structure must be in orbit, on the moon, or on another celestial body. The completion of the structure will be confirmed by either the agency responsible for its construction or an independent third-party recognized as an authority in space exploration, such as NASA, ESA, or a similar organization. In the event that the International Space Station is expanded beyond its 2023 volume, the new structure must still exceed the expanded volume. If no such structure is completed but is under active construction and projected to be larger than the ISS, the question will resolve as No. If multiple structures qualify, the largest by internal volume will be considered for resolution. In the event of ambiguity or lack of clear authoritative confirmation, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Donald Trump announce a new space initiative or program during any potential future presidency before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Donald Trump, during a term as President of the United States, announces a new space initiative or program. The announcement must be made in an official capacity, such as during a press conference, a White House briefing, a signed executive order, or a publicized policy document. The initiative or program must be distinct from previous space policies and have a clear mandate or goal, such as establishing a lunar base, launching a new class of space vehicles, or initiating a Mars exploration mission. The announcement must be corroborated by at least two reputable media outlets or an official press release from the White House. If Donald Trump does not serve as President before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In the event of ambiguity regarding the novelty or official nature of the announcement, the question will be resolved by a panel of three experts in space policy, whose decision will be final.

title: Will a major political figure in Germany publicly endorse an ethical framework, such as Kantian ethics or virtue ethics, as a guiding principle for their policy before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a current member of the German Federal Cabinet or a current leader of a political party represented in the Bundestag publicly endorses Kantian ethics, virtue ethics, or another well-defined ethical framework as a guiding principle for their policy. The endorsement must be explicit, referencing the ethical framework by name, and must be made in a public setting such as an official speech, published article, or recorded interview. The source of the endorsement must be verifiable through reputable media outlets, official government publications, or direct records from the political figure's office. In the event of ambiguity or dispute over the interpretation of the endorsement, a panel of three experts in political philosophy, appointed by a recognized academic institution, will determine whether the criteria have been met. If no such endorsement is made public by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the German national cricket team qualify for the ICC T20 World Cup by 2030?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if the German national cricket team is listed as a participant in any ICC T20 World Cup tournament that takes place before or during the year 2030. Qualification must be confirmed by the International Cricket Council (ICC) through official announcements or publications. In the event that the ICC T20 World Cup is discontinued, restructured, or if Germany merges with another cricketing body or nation, the question will resolve as No unless the new or restructured event includes a team that is predominantly composed of players eligible for the German national team as of 2023. If the ICC or another authoritative body does not provide clear information on the German team's qualification status by the resolution date, the question will resolve as Ambiguous.

title: Will Germany implement a nationwide ban on combustion engine vehicles by 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, the German government has passed legislation that prohibits the sale of new vehicles powered solely by internal combustion engines (ICEs) across the entire country. The ban must apply to all new passenger cars, light commercial vehicles, and motorcycles that operate exclusively on gasoline or diesel fuel. Hybrid vehicles that combine an ICE with an electric motor will not be subject to this ban. The resolution will rely on official statements from the German Federal Ministry of Transport and Digital Infrastructure or equivalent successor bodies, as well as the publication of the legislation in the Bundesgesetzblatt (Federal Law Gazette). In the event of ambiguity or partial bans, the question will resolve as No unless a full nationwide ban on the sale of new ICE-only vehicles is unambiguously in effect. If the legislation is passed but subsequently repealed or significantly amended to allow the sale of new ICE-only vehicles before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a cryptocurrency be used to fund a particle physics experiment by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2030, a cryptocurrency transaction is used to provide funding for a particle physics experiment. The funding must be verifiable through a transaction on a blockchain that is publicly accessible or through official statements from the research institution conducting the experiment. The experiment must be related to the field of particle physics and aim to investigate the fundamental particles and forces of the universe. The funding must be specifically earmarked for the experiment, not for general institutional support. In the event of ambiguity regarding the purpose of the funding, an official statement from the research institution will be considered definitive. If no such transaction or statement is publicly available by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.
